title: Systems Administrator
description: As a member of the Community Care Partners’ Information Technology Department, the Systems Administrator is responsible for providing day-to-day operational guidance and mentoring for a group of technology professionals. They are responsible for the development, maintenance, reliability, availability, and security of all corporate infrastructure and end-user computing. They will have the right mix of hands-on experience, strong interpersonal, leadership, and technical skills. The Systems Administrator II will be responsible for the performance that promotes excellent customer service, overall service excellence, and IT maturity. Supports and adheres to the Community Care Partners Code of Ethics, Business Standards, and Shared Values. Essential Functions and Responsibilities: Administer a "Mid-sized Network," running Microsoft Operating Systems in a Microsoft Active Directory Domain, including primary and backup domain controllers, member file and print servers, in a virtual and physical environment. Serves as a subject matter expert while developing and maintaining a deep understanding of Microsoft 365 productivity tools as well as other emerging technology third-party products. Analyze systems to protect data from unauthorized users and monitors compliance with the organization's information security policies and procedures. Utilizes automated vulnerability scanning tools. Identify and mitigate risks throughout project lifecycle. Participate in security control reviews and provide improvement guidance. Monitor organization's networks for security breaches and investigate when one occurs then recommend / implement strategies. Assists in security audits and provides security support for application and infrastructure-related projects. Proactively develop plans, schedules, and levels of support necessary when new technologies or applications are implemented. Develop and maintain a Disaster Recovery plan and backup strategy. Configure and maintain Community Care Partners’ mail server and email and web filtering technology. Maintain current hardware, software and licensing inventory including usernames and servers. Plan and recommend upgrades and training requirements for the annual budget. Install software upgrades and updates as needed. Monitors system utilization. Requirements and Qualifications: Education: A high school diploma/GED is required. A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, management information systems, or 6 years of equivalent comparable experience and or training. Certificate/License: VCP-DCV, MCSE, MCSA, or equivalent preferred. Experience: A minimum of six (6) years of high-level server configuration, maintenance, analysis, and troubleshooting experience required. Implementation of VDI, virtual environments, and system expansion solutions. Proactive network monitoring/auditing and alerting. Configuration, maintenance, and implementation of web traffic and spam filters. Hardware & software installation, patching, upgrades. Implementation of backup and recovery, business continuity and high availability methodologies. Knowledge and/or experience with digital forensics. Knowledge of designing baseline configuration guidelines and implementing continuous monitoring mechanisms of those guidelines for Azure cloud. Knowledge and/or experience with security incident management events. Knowledge of and experience with security monitoring methodologies such as patterns, watch lists, blacklists, log parsing, correlation, classification, event generation, taxonomy, filtering. Proven ability to be flexible and work hard, both independently and in a team environment, in a fast-paced environment with changing priorities. Experience working on teams to design solutions and integrate systems. Proven experience meeting goals, deadlines, and delivery dates. Community Care Partners is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO).

title: Systems Administrator
description: Our Story: Crude oil is an essential element of our nation’s energy supply - fueling our cars, trucks, airplanes, and factories, and heating and cooling our homes. As part of the energy mix, the United States relies on a steady supply of crude oil to produce products we use on a daily basis. LOOP plays a key role in meeting those daily energy needs as the single largest point of entry for waterborne crude oil coming into the U.S. LOOP is a joint venture of Marathon Petroleum Company, Shell Oil Company, and Valero, and is the only Deepwater Port in the U.S. capable of offloading and loading a wide range of vessels from Ultra Large Crude Carriers down to Medium Range Tankers. LOOP stores crude oil in eight underground caverns in a naturally occurring salt dome capable of storing approximately 60 million barrels. In addition, LOOP has a modern above-ground tank facility consisting of twenty-two tanks with a total storage capacity of 12 million barrels. LOOP has called Louisiana home for over forty years. With headquarters in Covington and operating facilities in Galliano and St. James LA, as well as a facility 20 miles in the Gulf of Mexico. SUMMARY DESCRIPTION The System Administrator is primarily responsible for the design, security, daily operations and maintenance of physical and virtual servers (supporting Active Directory, SQL, & Operational Technology applications), backup appliances (Unitrends), along with Operational Technology client workstations. This position will be on call on a rotational basis once onboarding is complete. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Manage Hardware and Software Lifecycles from planning through disposition, maintaining accurate asset inventories. Monitor the health of servers to assure uptime and operational reliability. Manage system backups, replication and restoration of servers and workstations; complete annual Disaster Recovery testing for servers. Manage Active Directory and group policy. Manage VMWare virtual servers and hosts. Manage a Security and Vulnerability Management program for all server systems, including antimalware updates, patching, whitelisting and event logging. Administer systems in alignment with cybersecurity regulations and industry standards (i.e. NIST Cybersecurity Framework). Develop, implement and manage weekly activity reports. Provide support for as needed to troubleshoot and monitor a 24x7x365 production system; participate in Incident Response processes to document lessons learned. Provide support for technical projects integrating new systems, enhancing existing systems and fixing system problems. Participate in developing and refining effective policies, procedures, and controls. Participate in the LOOP emergency response management plan by supporting off- site recovery facilities during emergency events. Maintain required training and certification(s) according to LOOP and OSHA Standards. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of and strictly adheres to LOOP safety requirements. Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical and/or Computer Engineering, or Computer Information Systems required. Experience: Minimum three to five (3-5) years prior experience as a Windows System Administrator. Basic scripting skills required (Powershell) Knowledge and skills to effectively manage Microsoft servers Knowledge and skills to effectively manage a virtualized server and VDI environment (VMware, vSphere, Horizon View, etc.) Knowledge of Unitrends backup appliances preferred Knowledge of Linux Fundamentals preferred Knowledge of the PKI Infrastructure preferred Licensure/Certification: ITIL or similar IT control framework, Microsoft certified (i.e. MCSE), and Security Administration certifications preferred. The successful candidate may be required in the future to relocate to any of LOOP’s operational facilities in Galliano, LA, St. James, LA or Covington, LA. Benefits: LOOP employees and their families enjoy a competitive health care package providing comprehensive medical care. LOOP provides both a traditional pension plan and a 401k savings plan with 7 percent company matching contribution to advance your long-term financial security. We offer one of the most competitive pay packages in our region including base pay and an annual incentive cash bonus for qualifying employees. These programs are designed to reward individual performance and align overall rewards with company and team performance. Paid time-off benefits include sick leave, vacation, holiday and disability pay. Please note, at this time, candidates for employment consideration must be fully vaccinated LOOP against COVID-19.

title: Systems Administrator
description: Our Story: Crude oil is an essential element of our nation’s energy supply - fueling our cars, trucks, airplanes, and factories, and heating and cooling our homes. As part of the energy mix, the United States relies on a steady supply of crude oil to produce products we use on a daily basis. LOOP plays a key role in meeting those daily energy needs as the single largest point of entry for waterborne crude oil coming into the U.S. LOOP is a joint venture of Marathon Petroleum Company, Shell Oil Company, and Valero, and is the only Deepwater Port in the U.S. capable of offloading and loading a wide range of vessels from Ultra Large Crude Carriers down to Medium Range Tankers. LOOP stores crude oil in eight underground caverns in a naturally occurring salt dome capable of storing approximately 60 million barrels. In addition, LOOP has a modern above-ground tank facility consisting of twenty-two tanks with a total storage capacity of 12 million barrels. LOOP has called Louisiana home for over forty years. With headquarters in Covington and operating facilities in Galliano and St. James LA, as well as a facility 20 miles in the Gulf of Mexico. SUMMARY DESCRIPTION The System Administrator is primarily responsible for the design, security, daily operations and maintenance of physical and virtual servers (supporting Active Directory, SQL, & Operational Technology applications), backup appliances (Unitrends), along with Operational Technology client workstations. This position will be on call on a rotational basis once onboarding is complete. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Manage Hardware and Software Lifecycles from planning through disposition, maintaining accurate asset inventories. Monitor the health of servers to assure uptime and operational reliability. Manage system backups, replication and restoration of servers and workstations; complete annual Disaster Recovery testing for servers. Manage Active Directory and group policy. Manage VMWare virtual servers and hosts. Manage a Security and Vulnerability Management program for all server systems, including antimalware updates, patching, whitelisting and event logging. Administer systems in alignment with cybersecurity regulations and industry standards (i.e. NIST Cybersecurity Framework). Develop, implement and manage weekly activity reports. Provide support for as needed to troubleshoot and monitor a 24x7x365 production system; participate in Incident Response processes to document lessons learned. Provide support for technical projects integrating new systems, enhancing existing systems and fixing system problems. Participate in developing and refining effective policies, procedures, and controls. Participate in the LOOP emergency response management plan by supporting off- site recovery facilities during emergency events. Maintain required training and certification(s) according to LOOP and OSHA Standards. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of and strictly adheres to LOOP safety requirements. Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical and/or Computer Engineering, or Computer Information Systems required. Experience: Minimum three to five (3-5) years prior experience as a Windows System Administrator. Basic scripting skills required (Powershell) Knowledge and skills to effectively manage Microsoft servers Knowledge and skills to effectively manage a virtualized server and VDI environment (VMware, vSphere, Horizon View, etc.) Knowledge of Unitrends backup appliances preferred Knowledge of Linux Fundamentals preferred Knowledge of the PKI Infrastructure preferred Licensure/Certification: ITIL or similar IT control framework, Microsoft certified (i.e. MCSE), and Security Administration certifications preferred. The successful candidate may be required in the future to relocate to any of LOOP’s operational facilities in Galliano, LA, St. James, LA or Covington, LA. Benefits: LOOP employees and their families enjoy a competitive health care package providing comprehensive medical care. LOOP provides both a traditional pension plan and a 401k savings plan with 7 percent company matching contribution to advance your long-term financial security. We offer one of the most competitive pay packages in our region including base pay and an annual incentive cash bonus for qualifying employees. These programs are designed to reward individual performance and align overall rewards with company and team performance. Paid time-off benefits include sick leave, vacation, holiday and disability pay. Please note, at this time, candidates for employment consideration must be fully vaccinated LOOP against COVID-19.

title: Senior Systems Administrator
description: This role includes installing and supporting software, debugging multiple systems, identity management and supporting users. The System Administrator I also performs high-level root cause analysis for service interruption recovery and implements preventive measures. On any given day, the System Administrator's duties may overlap with those of a System Engineer, Software Engineer, Database Administrator or Network Administrator/Engineer. Works in a team of System Administrators/Engineers and is capable of designing and implementing a predefined solution with minimal direction Provides value-driven ideas to improve system architecture or functionality. Incorporates new ideas into the overall design by focusing on security. usability, and reliability while minimizing cost. Must possess good communications skills, both oral and written. Must possess advanced knowledge (design, automation, integration, operation, and administration) in at least three of the following areas: networking, storage, virtualization, compute (OS) Must possess advanced knowledge in various hardware including servers, storage platforms, firewalls, routers, switches, and interconnection devices. Must possess knowledge and background experience in datacenter infrastructure and networks supporting data, voice, and video. Must possess excellent troubleshooting skills using a variety of tools to identify and remediate system issues.

title: Systems Administrator
description: Our Story: Crude oil is an essential element of our nation’s energy supply - fueling our cars, trucks, airplanes, and factories, and heating and cooling our homes. As part of the energy mix, the United States relies on a steady supply of crude oil to produce products we use on a daily basis. LOOP plays a key role in meeting those daily energy needs as the single largest point of entry for waterborne crude oil coming into the U.S. LOOP is a joint venture of Marathon Petroleum Company, Shell Oil Company, and Valero, and is the only Deepwater Port in the U.S. capable of offloading and loading a wide range of vessels from Ultra Large Crude Carriers down to Medium Range Tankers. LOOP stores crude oil in eight underground caverns in a naturally occurring salt dome capable of storing approximately 60 million barrels. In addition, LOOP has a modern above-ground tank facility consisting of twenty-two tanks with a total storage capacity of 12 million barrels. LOOP has called Louisiana home for over forty years. With headquarters in Covington and operating facilities in Galliano and St. James LA, as well as a facility 20 miles in the Gulf of Mexico. SUMMARY DESCRIPTION The System Administrator is primarily responsible for the design, security, daily operations and maintenance of physical and virtual servers (supporting Active Directory, SQL, & Operational Technology applications), backup appliances (Unitrends), along with Operational Technology client workstations. This position will be on call on a rotational basis once onboarding is complete. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Manage Hardware and Software Lifecycles from planning through disposition, maintaining accurate asset inventories. Monitor the health of servers to assure uptime and operational reliability. Manage system backups, replication and restoration of servers and workstations; complete annual Disaster Recovery testing for servers. Manage Active Directory and group policy. Manage VMWare virtual servers and hosts. Manage a Security and Vulnerability Management program for all server systems, including antimalware updates, patching, whitelisting and event logging. Administer systems in alignment with cybersecurity regulations and industry standards (i.e. NIST Cybersecurity Framework). Develop, implement and manage weekly activity reports. Provide support for as needed to troubleshoot and monitor a 24x7x365 production system; participate in Incident Response processes to document lessons learned. Provide support for technical projects integrating new systems, enhancing existing systems and fixing system problems. Participate in developing and refining effective policies, procedures, and controls. Participate in the LOOP emergency response management plan by supporting off- site recovery facilities during emergency events. Maintain required training and certification(s) according to LOOP and OSHA Standards. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of and strictly adheres to LOOP safety requirements. Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical and/or Computer Engineering, or Computer Information Systems required. Experience: Minimum three to five (3-5) years prior experience as a Windows System Administrator. Basic scripting skills required (Powershell) Knowledge and skills to effectively manage Microsoft servers Knowledge and skills to effectively manage a virtualized server and VDI environment (VMware, vSphere, Horizon View, etc.) Knowledge of Unitrends backup appliances preferred Knowledge of Linux Fundamentals preferred Knowledge of the PKI Infrastructure preferred Licensure/Certification: ITIL or similar IT control framework, Microsoft certified (i.e. MCSE), and Security Administration certifications preferred. The successful candidate may be required in the future to relocate to any of LOOP’s operational facilities in Galliano, LA, St. James, LA or Covington, LA. Benefits: LOOP employees and their families enjoy a competitive health care package providing comprehensive medical care. LOOP provides both a traditional pension plan and a 401k savings plan with 7 percent company matching contribution to advance your long-term financial security. We offer one of the most competitive pay packages in our region including base pay and an annual incentive cash bonus for qualifying employees. These programs are designed to reward individual performance and align overall rewards with company and team performance. Paid time-off benefits include sick leave, vacation, holiday and disability pay. Please note, at this time, candidates for employment consideration must be fully vaccinated LOOP against COVID-19.

title: Systems Administrator
description: Our Story: Crude oil is an essential element of our nation’s energy supply - fueling our cars, trucks, airplanes, and factories, and heating and cooling our homes. As part of the energy mix, the United States relies on a steady supply of crude oil to produce products we use on a daily basis. LOOP plays a key role in meeting those daily energy needs as the single largest point of entry for waterborne crude oil coming into the U.S. LOOP is a joint venture of Marathon Petroleum Company, Shell Oil Company, and Valero, and is the only Deepwater Port in the U.S. capable of offloading and loading a wide range of vessels from Ultra Large Crude Carriers down to Medium Range Tankers. LOOP stores crude oil in eight underground caverns in a naturally occurring salt dome capable of storing approximately 60 million barrels. In addition, LOOP has a modern above-ground tank facility consisting of twenty-two tanks with a total storage capacity of 12 million barrels. LOOP has called Louisiana home for over forty years. With headquarters in Covington and operating facilities in Galliano and St. James LA, as well as a facility 20 miles in the Gulf of Mexico. SUMMARY DESCRIPTION The System Administrator is primarily responsible for the design, security, daily operations and maintenance of physical and virtual servers (supporting Active Directory, SQL, & Operational Technology applications), backup appliances (Unitrends), along with Operational Technology client workstations. This position will be on call on a rotational basis once onboarding is complete. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Manage Hardware and Software Lifecycles from planning through disposition, maintaining accurate asset inventories. Monitor the health of servers to assure uptime and operational reliability. Manage system backups, replication and restoration of servers and workstations; complete annual Disaster Recovery testing for servers. Manage Active Directory and group policy. Manage VMWare virtual servers and hosts. Manage a Security and Vulnerability Management program for all server systems, including antimalware updates, patching, whitelisting and event logging. Administer systems in alignment with cybersecurity regulations and industry standards (i.e. NIST Cybersecurity Framework). Develop, implement and manage weekly activity reports. Provide support for as needed to troubleshoot and monitor a 24x7x365 production system; participate in Incident Response processes to document lessons learned. Provide support for technical projects integrating new systems, enhancing existing systems and fixing system problems. Participate in developing and refining effective policies, procedures, and controls. Participate in the LOOP emergency response management plan by supporting off- site recovery facilities during emergency events. Maintain required training and certification(s) according to LOOP and OSHA Standards. Maintain up-to-date knowledge of and strictly adheres to LOOP safety requirements. Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical and/or Computer Engineering, or Computer Information Systems required. Experience: Minimum three to five (3-5) years prior experience as a Windows System Administrator. Basic scripting skills required (Powershell) Knowledge and skills to effectively manage Microsoft servers Knowledge and skills to effectively manage a virtualized server and VDI environment (VMware, vSphere, Horizon View, etc.) Knowledge of Unitrends backup appliances preferred Knowledge of Linux Fundamentals preferred Knowledge of the PKI Infrastructure preferred Licensure/Certification: ITIL or similar IT control framework, Microsoft certified (i.e. MCSE), and Security Administration certifications preferred. The successful candidate may be required in the future to relocate to any of LOOP’s operational facilities in Galliano, LA, St. James, LA or Covington, LA. Benefits: LOOP employees and their families enjoy a competitive health care package providing comprehensive medical care. LOOP provides both a traditional pension plan and a 401k savings plan with 7 percent company matching contribution to advance your long-term financial security. We offer one of the most competitive pay packages in our region including base pay and an annual incentive cash bonus for qualifying employees. These programs are designed to reward individual performance and align overall rewards with company and team performance. Paid time-off benefits include sick leave, vacation, holiday and disability pay. Please note, at this time, candidates for employment consideration must be fully vaccinated LOOP against COVID-19.
